title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. The amendment increases the credit percentage for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property to 50 percent. There is no dollar limitation for property related to hydrogen. The credit is also allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, with a focus on hydrogen fuel storage or dispensing. The amendment expands the definition of specified off-highway vehicles to include all motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding certain exceptions. The amendment extends the credit for hydrogen property through 2016 and specifies that it applies to property placed in service after the enactment date for taxable years ending after that date. It also repeals a limitation for taxable years beginning after the enactment date. The Act extends the credit for hydrogen property through 2016 and removes a limitation for taxable years beginning after the enactment date. The amendment applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2014. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50% credit for fuel cell property in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency of 70% or more, and a 40% credit for systems with an efficiency of at least 60% but less than 70%. The tax credit for fuel cell property with an efficiency of at least 60% but less than 70% is subject to certain limitations and amendments under the Internal Revenue Code. The tax credit limitations for fuel cell property are specified based on capacity, with different amounts for different types of property. The amendments apply to taxable years after the enactment of the Act.
